item.title: Outside 33-35 Jamestown Road, 26th November
item.description:
New development on 33-35 Jamestown Road with new build to be erected where the old Corporation Yard and Eng Depot is. A one lane lay-by on Jamestown Road has been approved by Camden - snip attached. Both trees in this location will be in the middle of the layby and new build with materials being lifted via tower crane. We would like to request tree pruning on both sides of both trees to ensure no branches and leaves caught in the tower crane lifts and clash with the new build. We would need pruning to take place in February when layby will be instated.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57, Jamestown Road, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Green bin didn't empty bins properly, 26th November
item.description:
Since first thing some food has been left between 81/83 strongbow crescent. I can't pick it up as physically can't. So swept it to the side bit so people can walk down the path. We use 2 green cadet bins from Sainsburys that are decent and definitely not our waste. However they done this is not good. And even if in dark why are they not checking pavements and paths with a head light. Then I come down from the top of our houses and there was more spilt outside someone's. They maybe a work as bins still out. We will live on top of station scared because of mice or rats. It's in need of a sweep down here asap. Thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Strongbow Crescent, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive litter and rubbish on our residential street, 26th November
item.description:
Hi, This has been a continued issue - myself and my neighbours find ourselves having to report and request street cleaning almost on a weekly basis. This week it seems the rubbish is out of control. Please can someone tend to it? MAny thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Helmsley Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox, 26th November
item.description:

item.title: Uneven pavement, 26th November
item.description:
Tiles on the pavement by the road outside 181 Denmark Hill have moved and are a tripping hazard. As you can see by the pictures this is the public highway not the private road at 181. They have been like this for over 6 months and have already tripped a number of people.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 218, Denmark Hill, Dulwich Village, Greater London
